Ad Text:
$142,838 to $150,860 (HEW Level 9) plus 17% employer's superannuation contribution and annual leave loading
Hybrid Working | Positive, team-oriented work environment
Based at Macquarie University, Wallumattagal Campus, North Ryde

Macquarie University is hiring for a Lead Data Engineer for our Data Solutions team within Business Intelligence and Reporting. As a Lead Data Engineer, you will work with the relevant teams to lead the development and optimisation of data and analytics architecture, as well as optimising data flow and collection to deliver integrated and quality business information and reporting solutions.

Business Intelligence and Reporting is responsible for enabling evidence-based decision-making across the University.

Key Accountabilities

Adopt and enhance existing processes to design and implement data orchestration workflows, managing curated datasets through landing zones, enterprise data warehouses, and presentation layers for insight generation.

Collaborate with the lead modeller to translate requirements into production-ready outputs.

Partner with stakeholders to understand and support their data infrastructure needs, troubleshooting and resolving technical issues.

Deploy data models into production using CI/CD pipelines, ensuring seamless integration.

Develop and manage data acquisition pipelines, ingestion workflows, and data lake capabilities.

Work alongside relevant teams to deploy Machine Learning models for predictive analytics and advanced insights.

Leverage generative AI and Natural Language Processing (NLP) to implement end-to-end solutions, enabling stakeholders to derive deep insights from structured data collaborating with the Mcquarie AI Team.

Identify, design, and implement process improvements to automate workflows, optimise data delivery, and enhance infrastructure efficiency and scalability.

Create and maintain core documentation for data models, including DDLs, ETL mappings, data dictionaries, and change registers.

Support the implementation of data asset standards and governance processes to ensure data quality and compliance.

About You

Tertiary qualifications in Data Analytics, Data Science, Business, Statistics, or equivalent experience.

Proficient with database, data pipeline, and workflow management tools such as Snowflake, JIRA, Wiki, DBT, Apache Airflow, Python, Linux, and GitHub.

Advanced skills in designing, testing, and validating data transformation and ETL routines using tools like DBT, Apache Airflow, Python, and Alteryx.

Strong hands-on experience with Data Vault 2 and dimensional data model implementation.

Proven track record of providing technical leadership in the delivery of complex enterprise data or integration solutions.

Exceptional verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to engage with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Experience working in an agile squad environment is desirable.

About Us

Macquarie is a university engaged with the real and often complex problems and opportunities that define our lives. Celebrating its 60th year in 2024, it was established as a bold experiment in higher education and designed to break from educational traditions to work in tandem with industry. Institutionally we strive for the extraordinary by challenging convention and embracing different views. Our pioneering culture has encouraged and inspired students, staff and collaborators to break free from conventional thinking, and to actively shape the complex issues that define the future of humanity.

Why work at Macquarie

We rank amongst the top employers in the Australian Workplace Employers Index, having recently earned a five-star rating in the QS World Rankings with the highest rating for employability.

Our prime location, we are walking distance from Macquarie University Metro Station and Macquarie Shopping Centre. Not only are we close, take a look at our benefits on offer:

17% Superannuation

Subsidised onsite parking options

Flexible working options

Training and professional development

Onsite childcare facilities

Discounted health insurance (Medibank)

Onsite vacation care

Employee Assistance Program

Subsidised membership at the Sport & Aquatic Centre

Onsite GP, imaging & physio clinics

For role specific enquiries, please reach out to our Hiring Manager at chitrani.gunasekera@mq.edu.au.

If you're already part of the Macquarie Group (MQ University, U@MQ, MQ Health, MGSM), you'll need to apply through your employee Workday account. To apply for this job: Login to Workday and go to the Careers App > Find Jobs.

A Place Where You Belong

At Macquarie, we believe diversity makes us stronger, inclusion drives our success, and belonging inspires us to do our best work. We are proud to foster a community where different backgrounds, identities, and experiences are valued, and where our people are empowered to thrive through supportive leadership, shared responsibility, and a deep commitment to genuine care and respect for our community. Find out more about our vision for a truly inclusive workplace in our Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging Framework.

Flexible Work

At Macquarie, we believe by providing flexibility in when, where and how work is done, we can support our staff to manage their personal commitments, while optimising their work performance and contributions to the University. See how we lead in flexible work to enable an outcome focused and inclusive workplace. To learn more about our culture and hiring process, visit our Jobs at Macquarie page.

Manager, Technology & Business Process
Location: Sydney | Full-time
We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Technology & Business Process Manager to lead business-critical technology initiatives across data & analytics, automation, and process improvement. This is a fantastic opportunity for a echnology leader to bridge business needs with technical solutions, enabling smarter, faster, and more efficient operations.
Key Responsibilities:

Lead and manage a high-performing team across data, automation, and business process improvement.
Own the lifecycle of business applications, ensuring they are scalable, secure, and aligned with strategic goals.
Drive digital transformation initiatives, including process automation, data strategy, and application optimisation.
Build strong relationships with senior stakeholders and vendors, translating complex technical concepts into actionable business solutions.
Champion continuous improvement and innovation while balancing practicality, cost, and speed to value.
Essential Experience & Skills:

8+ years leading cross-functional technology teams in complex environments.
Proven experience in data strategy, reporting enablement, and process automation.
Strong stakeholder management and vendor negotiation skills.
Hands-on understanding of cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure), analytics tools (Power BI preferred), and enterprise applications.
Excellent communication, problem-solving, and leadership skills.
Retail industry knowledge is an advantage!
Why This Role:
This is an opportunity to make a tangible impact by transforming business processes, improving operational efficiency, and enabling data-driven decision-making. You’ll work closely with a collaborative, high-performing team and influence key strategic initiatives.
Applications:
To apply, please submit your CV and a brief cover letter outlining your relevant experience and approach to technology-driven business transformation.

About us

From humble roots in Eromanga, QLD, we’ve been fuelling the furthest corners of Australia for over 40 years. But we think the most exciting journey’s still on the horizon.

Joining IOR puts you in the driver’s seat. You'll get the opportunity to own your ambition and build a worthwhile career - all while seeing your impact on the faces of your team and the communities we serve. You won't see our logo on racing cars, but you will be part of a team that helps fuel LifeFlight's choppers.

Whether you’re driving trucks, designing tech, manufacturing tanks or managing logistics behind the scenes, a career with IOR means going further, in every sense of the word - in your relationships, your impact and your remarkable career.

Right team

Work with people you trust and form relationships that will go the distance
Build something great with a team that will have a laugh and have your back

Right Track

So many career opportunities to explore... and you’re in the driver’s seat
Grow with us at IOR - the bigger we get, the bigger your opportunities become

Right Now

We want you to succeed, so you’re given trust and autonomy to do what it takes
Real momentum, real impact and the sense that there’s plenty more to come

About the role

As our Data & Analytics Manager, you're at the heart of smarter decision-making — turning data into direction across the business. You’ll lead the charge in shaping how we collect, protect, and use data to drive performance, elevate customer experience, and fuel strategic growth. From frontline operations to boardroom strategy, your insights power every move we make. You’ll own the journey from raw data to real impact — translating complex needs into clear, actionable solutions that help every team thrive.

Lead performance reporting across digital, email, social, and paid channels using HubSpot, GA4, and Tableau — driving smarter engagement and marketing ROI.
Champion customer experience and conversion uplift through A/B and multivariate testing, advanced analytics (CLV, attribution, propensity), and integrated journey mapping across Zoho, Zendesk, and HubSpot.
Deliver strategic insights from customer data, VOC programs, and dashboards to inform budgeting, elevate marketing performance, and align cross-functional teams.
Design and implement enterprise-wide data strategies — from governance and data integrity to predictive modelling, machine learning, and system integration (BC, payroll, CMMS).
Mentor a high-performing analytics team and build scalable frameworks that support operational analytics, CRM optimisation, pricing, transport efficiency, and asset lifecycle profitability.

What IOR are Looking For:

IOR is on the lookout for a data-driven leader ready to turn insight into impact. We're seeking a strategic, hands-on Data & Analytics Manager to drive smarter decisions across our business — from customer experience to operational efficiency. If you thrive on building high-performing teams, shaping enterprise-wide data strategies, and translating complex metrics into clear, actionable outcomes, we’d love to hear from you.

Tertiary qualification in Data Science, Analytics, Information Systems, or a related field, with a strong foundation in modern data architectures and large-scale datasets.
Advanced proficiency in Power BI, Tableau, SQL, Python, Excel, GA4, HubSpot, and Zoho — turning complex data into clear, actionable insights that drive performance across the business.
Skilled in advanced modelling techniques including regression, segmentation, scenario design, and lifecycle tracking — with a sharp eye for problem-solving and critical thinking.
Deep understanding of data governance, privacy, and compliance, with a proven ability to translate analytics into high-impact recommendations and business cases.
Strategic leader and cross-functional communicator, known for stakeholder engagement, mentoring teams, and championing a data-driven culture across all business functions.

Why join IOR?

You can feel it from day one. The energy, the growth… the sense that this place is going somewhere. And you're not just along for the ride. You’re behind the wheel.

IOR’s the kind of place where you put your name to a project, and you own it. The wins, the challenges, and everything in between we back you to see it through, even when things don’t go to plan. Support is always there if you need it. Otherwise, you’re trusted to do what it takes to keep things running.

You don’t get that in too many places.

Approaching each day through our values of Innovation finding solutions, Our Communities serving people, and Reliability getting results, our team is focused on delivering what really matters to our customers. It’s this mindset that drives us forward.

The best part? As we grow bigger, the opportunities get bigger, too. Backed by a solid strategy and a right to win, joining our team means more projects, more challenges, and more chances to stretch yourself.

What does this mean for you?

Be part of an unbeatable culture where people really do enjoy coming to work
Investment in your career through training and development programs, ongoing support, plus the backing to take your career in whichever direction you choose
Work hard, play hard with our Blue Squad - monthly trivia, barbecues and plenty of laughs!
Staff and family discounts on fuel (obviously!)

Ready to go further with IOR?

If this sounds like you, don't overthink it - just apply! We're looking forward to meeting you.

We provide an equal employment opportunity for all; we see the value in diversity and celebrate individuality. This looks like respectful conversations and a safe workplace where everyone thrives.

About Many Rivers

Many Rivers exists to help Indigenous and other Australians in disadvantaged circumstances to improve their situations through the provision of microenterprise and community economic development support. We create change and economic opportunities through the work we do. Inspired by Christian values we provide a culture centred around Care, Respect and Accountability.

About the role

The Business Development team is responsible for attracting and retaining partnerships and financial support to fund operations and enable impact for clients and communities. Within the team, and reporting to the Head of Business Development, the Impact Reporting and Analytics Manager provides high quality qualitative and quantitative support to all new, and existing, fundraising and partnership opportunities.

This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced funding and highly analytics literate individual to join Many Rivers and make a critical contribution to the growth of the organisation.

Our approach to impact evaluation and funding is progressive and industry leading. The role involves preparing reports that describe (in words and numbers) the actual/projected impact of programs, ensuring funding contract compliance, managing risks, and maintaining accurate records. The role also prepares supporting material data-driven insights to enhance fundraising strategies (grants, investments) and impact development.

Key position responsibilities - please note that interstate travel will be required as part of this role.

Fundraising Analytics and Insights

Prepare data-driven insights and visualisations to support fundraising pitch material.
Analyse external and internal data on funder engagement, funding success rates, and program outcomes to inform future opportunities.
Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to tailor insights for different audiences and opportunities.
Support the Head of Business Development to develop and implement frameworks for measuring and reporting on the impact of Many Rivers programs, aligned to all funding opportunities.
Work with Deloitte Access Economics to enhance understanding of Evaluation outcomes and link to new fundraising opportunities.
Support the CEO and Head of BD to scope and obtain ad hoc insights to support strategic fundraising opportunities.

CRM Management and Data Integrity

Maintain accurate and up-to-date records in the BD CRM system related to funding partnerships, opportunities, key contacts and interactions.
Implement data quality controls and ensure consistency across partner profiles, funding history, and engagement notes.
Support integration of CRM data into reporting and analytics workflows.

Quantitative Analysis and Financial Modelling

Design, build, and maintain financial models that support both new and continuing fundraising initiatives (including investment).
Model scenarios for funding proposals, including cost-benefit analyses, ROI projections, and sustainability forecasts.
Translate complex financial data into clear, actionable insights for internal and external stakeholders.

Impact Development and Continuous Improvement

Provide quantitative support to innovative social impact investment products that align with the organisation’s mission and goals.
Develop and refine frameworks for measuring and communicating impact across programs and pilots.
Identify opportunities to improve data collection, analysis, and reporting processes.

Contribute to team goals

Positively contribute to overall team performance, morale and a culture of ownership, reflecting the organisational values of care, respect and accountability.
Represent the BD team to a high standard through internal and external engagement.

About You

Aligned to Many Rivers' Mission and Strategic Objectives.
Share Many Rivers' motivation and commitment to serve people without regard to ethnicity, gender or religious affiliation.
Impeccable integrity, trust, respect, stewardship and commitment to people in disadvantaged circumstances and strong cultural awareness.
Resilient character with the ability to work and sustain long term.
Personally motivated, proactive, organised and self disciplined.
Personal conduct that is professional, courteous and beyond reproach.

Selection Criteria

Experience in financial management, economics, or statistics with advanced MS Excel skills and financial modelling proficiency.
Knowledge of business intelligence systems and processes.
Strong written and verbal communication skills for translating data into insights, and actionable opportunities.
Understanding of the social impact investment sector in Australia.
Ability to work collaboratively and autonomously to achieve deadlines with high quality.
Experience in impact measurement, compliance, and risk mitigation.
Proficiency in CRM systems and reporting on progress and outcomes.

How to Apply:

Please submit your resume and a cover letter addressing the Selection Criteria.

Successful candidates will be required to complete pre-employment checks including Criminal History Check, Equifax Check and Working with Children/Vulnerable People Check where applicable.

Job Title: Principal Portfolio Asset | Adelaide-12 Month Fixed Term Contract
Ad Text:
Company description:

About BHP

At BHP we support our people to grow, learn, develop their skills and reach their potential. With a global portfolio of operations, we offer a diverse and inclusive environment with extraordinary career opportunities. Our strategy is to focus on creating a safe work environment where our employees feel strongly connected to our values and objectives, and where the capability of our people is key to our success.

Come and be a part of this success.



Job description:

About the Role

Reporting to the Lead Project Controls - Technology Delivery Copper SA. The role is responsible for providing technical expertise in the monitoring and governance of a portfolio of projects in order to seek opportunities for value creation and preservation by setting program-wide strategies for standardisation, replication and continuity.

Please note this position is 5:2 Monday to Friday based in Adelaide with regular travel as required. We can also consider part time option or jobshare.

Key Responsibilities:

Conducts benchmarking, implements prioritisation methodologies and identifies key investment drivers to effectively manage key requirements across the portfolio.
Develops and communicates insights that guide data driven action and decision making.
Makes evidence based and strategic decisions in alignment with longer term business objectives.
Conducts presentations and facilitates workshops using storytelling to connect, influence and engage the audience.
Sources information, plans and conducts analyses to support evidence based decision making.
Applies an understanding of the business context, BHP operating model and ways of working to enhance decision making, productivity and value chain performance.
Engages the capabilities of the entire organisation.
Strives to achieve 100% safety, 100% customer value and 0% waste.
Knows our customers and is obsessed with meeting their needs.
About You

To be successful in this role, strong communication and proven influence to navigate multiple stakeholders to drive investment outcomes to achieve the business objectives. It requires the ability to accumulate accurate information whilst maintaining attention to detail. Being naturally curious you will inspire change and make a difference to those around you building relationships across a range of internal and external teams.

Key experience and attributes:

Led enterprise-level portfolio governance and prioritisation, aligning initiatives with strategic objectives and delivering measurable value across multiple functions or assets.
Designed and implemented performance management frameworks, including KPIs, dashboards, and reporting routines to drive accountability, transparency, and continuous improvement.
Influenced senior stakeholders and governance forums, using scenario modelling and value optimisation techniques to support investment decisions and strategic trade-offs.

About Our Process

At BHP, we are committed to employing individuals who align with the BHP Charter Values and meet the requirements of the role. As part of the recruitment process, there are a number of checks which may be conducted to demonstrate applicants suitability for a role including police / criminal background checks, medical, drug and alcohol testing, due diligence checks, right to work checks, and/or reference checks.

If you are already employed directly by BHP, please log in using your BHP email address or apply via our internal jobs portal.

Supporting a Diverse Workforce


The size, stability and magnitude of our business not only provides significant opportunity for professional development, but also attractive salary packages with performance-based bonuses and a best-in-class employee share program. We know there are many aspects of our employees' lives that are important, and work is only one of these, so we offer benefits to enable your work to fit with your life. These benefits include flexible working options, a generous paid parental leave policy, other extended leave entitlements and parent rooms. 

At BHP, we know that we are strengthened by diversity. We are an Equal Opportunity employer that is committed to making BHP a safe and inclusive workplace where everyone can thrive and be at their best every day. We are focused on creating a workforce that's more diverse and represents the communities where we work and live. providing a work environment in which everyone is included, treated fairly and with respect. We are an Equal Opportunity employer and recognise that true diversity includes gender, age, race, disability status, sexual orientation, religion, neurodiversity, education levels, and many more aspects of your identity.

BHP is committed to providing a recruitment process that is fair, equitable and accessible for all. If you have a disability, we know that it may be helpful for us to adjust our process to make it equitable for your individual situation. If you would like to reach out to someone about your situation and our recruitment process, please email us at inclusion@bhp.com.

Come and be a part of this success.



Job description:

About the Role

Reporting to the Technology Chief of Staff, this role is focused on driving continuous improvement of the Global Technology function at BHP. As part of this team, you'll be ensuring corporate objectives are translated into actionable plans, helping to communicate, manage and analyse implementation to facilitate strategy delivery. This role can be based in Brisbane, Adelaide or Perth

Accountabilities:

Executes projects that improve the Technology function culture and effectiveness; identifying performance issues and opportunities, building solutions and implementing at pace.
Works directly with senior leaders to support broader team effectiveness, engagement and delivery.
Identifies and implements opportunities to streamline and uplift processes across the Technology function to improve efficiency and reduce waste.
Compiles high-quality reporting for Executive-level BHP leadership.
Optimises the flow of information to and from the Technology Leadership Team to ensure timely decision-making and an aligned, informed workforce.
Coordinates and facilitates problem solving activities and workshops with senior leaders. Uses storytelling to enhance communications and presentations to connect and engage audiences internal and external to Technology.
Proactively manages a diverse range of stakeholder relationships and integrates across team boundaries to ensure whole of function and business outcomes are delivered.

About You

5+ years working experience, including experience in a business analyst or consultant role
Strong project management skills, coupled with a continuous improvement mindset to see projects through to business outcomes
Relevant degree in engineering, finance, business or IT recommended
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Business acumen and financial literacy
Skilled at strategic thinking and change management
Strong communication and stakeholder engagement skills
Relevant degree in engineering, finance, business or IT recommended
Resources industry and/or IT/Technology experience recommended

About Our Process

At BHP, we are committed to employing individuals who align with the BHP Charter Values and meet the requirements of the role. As part of the recruitment process, there are a number of checks which may be conducted to demonstrate applicants suitability for a role including police / criminal background checks, medical, drug and alcohol testing, due diligence checks, right to work checks, and/or reference checks.

If you are already employed directly by BHP, please log in using your BHP email address or apply via our internal jobs portal.

Supporting a Diverse Workforce


The size, stability and magnitude of our business not only provides significant opportunity for professional development, but also attractive salary packages with performance-based bonuses and a best-in-class employee share program. We know there are many aspects of our employees' lives that are important, and work is only one of these, so we offer benefits to enable your work to fit with your life. These benefits include flexible working options, a generous paid parental leave policy, other extended leave entitlements and parent rooms. 

At BHP, we know that we are strengthened by diversity. We are an Equal Opportunity employer that is committed to making BHP a safe and inclusive workplace where everyone can thrive and be at their best every day. We are focused on creating a workforce that's more diverse and represents the communities where we work and live. providing a work environment in which everyone is included, treated fairly and with respect. We are an Equal Opportunity employer and recognise that true diversity includes gender, age, race, disability status, sexual orientation, religion, neurodiversity, education levels, and many more aspects of your identity.

BHP is committed to providing a recruitment process that is fair, equitable and accessible for all. If you have a disability, we know that it may be helpful for us to adjust our process to make it equitable for your individual situation. If you would like to reach out to someone about your situation and our recruitment process, please email us at inclusion@bhp.com.

Company: Talent – Specialists in tech, transformation & beyond
Ad Text:
Purpose of the Role

Working in the Energy Sector, our client is looking for a Senior Systems Analyst with a strong focus on Payroll. You will be responsible for ensuring that the payroll systems are accurately configured, integrated, and compliant to support efficient and reliable payroll operations.

The System Analyst will collaborate with HR, operations, and other stakeholder groups to capture requirements, map current and future processes, and support user experience design. They will work with internal SMEs and external vendors to guide system configuration, integration, and testing.

About you:

Demonstrated experience leading business analysis activities for complex HCM, HRIS or Workforce Management system implementations
Proven ability to build trust and facilitate collaboration with cross-functional stakeholder groups including HR, operations, Payroll IT, and executive leadership.
Demonstrated accountability for capturing, refining, and ensuring successful delivery of business and system requirements across project phases.
Skilled in understanding and documenting current and future state end to end processes, creating user personas and journey maps, and translating operational needs into system functionality.
Experience partnering with external software vendors and implementation partners to support system configuration, data mapping, testing, and issue resolution.
Proficient in maintaining accurate and up-to-date business requirements, risk logs, traceability matrices, and decision registers.
Able to contribute to test script creation, coordinate UAT activities, and facilitate defect resolution with SMEs and vendors.
Tertiary qualifications in Business/Information Systems or IT related discipline (highly desirable)
Demonstrated experience working within the Transport industry (highly desirable)

Category:
Programme & Project Management (Information & Communication Technology)
Government - State (Government & Defence)
Ad Text:
Position overview

2 Year Maximum Term Contract, Full-Time opportunity
True hybrid working - work from home and our Mitcham office
$166,650 per annum inclusive of 12% superannuation

About us
We're on a mission to create a brighter future, where you can be a change maker at the actual source. We're one of Australia's largest water utilities with over 30% of Victoria's population relying on us for their essential water and sanitation services.

Our award-winning culture fosters an inclusive, collaborative, and flexible environment that enables our people to thrive. Here, you'll be inspired and challenged to grow alongside us.

We're committed to reconciliation and supporting the self-determined role for Traditional Owners/Custodians in water and land management.

The role
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Data Analytics Specialist to join our growing data team. This role will be responsible for delivering high quality Power BI data models and intuitive self-serve dashboards. This role will work closely with teams in Data, Asset Services, other business stakeholders and external vendors to drive implementation, training, adoption and innovation of our Enterprise Data Analytics platform, as well as other business prioritised projects.

This role is a hands-on, business-facing analytics role requiring strong communication skills, data transformation and modelling expertise, and a deep understanding of customer-oriented enterprise-grade reporting. The successful candidate will play a key role in transforming the way our organisation translates complex data into actionable insights and dashboards that drive improvements in customer engagement, satisfaction, water asset management and service delivery.

Your key responsibilities

Build, transform and maintain robust Power BI data semantic models, using DAX and Power Query, integrating data from the Azure Databricks in alignment with best Data Governance and coding practices
Design and deliver intuitive, self-service Power BI dashboards that surface insights to empower business stakeholders with quicker and more accurate data driven decisions.
Incorporate modelling and visualisation best practices for optimised user experience and maintaining platform performance.
Collaborate with external vendors to guide and incorporate reporting solution best practices in YVW's evolving Enterprise Data Analytics Platform
Collaborate with stakeholders across Data, Asset and Retails services and others to define and translate reporting project needs that support customer-focused strategies and operational goals into reporting solutions.
Support upskilling and reporting solution adoption through fostering strong relationships across the business, updating user guides and running user training sessions on BI tools, semantic models and self-serve analytics.
Manage project releases, deployments, and BAU support for analytics platforms, while providing advanced troubleshooting and Level 3 support.
Identify and present insights to business stakeholders to influence business decisions and improve water asset management.
Contribute to the ongoing evolution of the enterprise data strategy and relevant project streams, ensuring solutions align with strategic goals and data governance standards.


What we're looking for

Extensive experience designing and developing enterprise-grade, self-service dashboards and reports using Power BI or equivalent BI tools, with a focus on usability, scalability, and performance. (8+ years highly desirable)
Strong expertise in Power BI data modelling, including DAX, Power Query, and dashboard/report design to support intuitive and impactful analytics solutions.
Skilled in translating business requirements into compelling data visualisations, data storytelling, and well-defined KPIs, driving alignment between analytics and business goals.
Experience with Power BI dataflows and seamless integration with Azure Databricks or similar cloud-based data platforms for scalable and automated data transformation pipelines.
Proficient in SQL for efficient data extraction, transformation, analysis, and validation in both operational and analytical contexts.
Hands-on experience with asset management platforms and delivering analytics tailored to asset management, supporting use cases such as asset performance, lifecycle tracking, and operational optimization.
Delivered engaging training and enablement programs to enhance data model literacy, BI tool proficiency, and foster wider reporting adoption across business units.
Collaborative in working with stakeholders and SMEs to define reporting requirements, manage expectations and project timelines, ensure data relevance, and deliver actionable insights aligned with business strategy.

To view the full position description, click HERE.

Why Yarra Valley Water?
We celebrate and encourage new thinking at every level. Creating opportunities for you to grow - both professionally, and personally. When you flourish, we all do.

$166,650 per annum inclusive of 12% superannuation
Flexible working arrangements where our people are empowered to design their days with their team. Read our hybrid playbook HERE.
Free and secure on-site parking with on-site café at our Mitcham office
14 weeks paid leave parental leave
15 days paid personal leave, which can be used for caring, wellbeing, mental health, menstrual or menopause
Request to swap certain public holidays for another day of paid leave

To read more about our benefits and culture, read our employee handbook HERE.

Did you know?
Research shows that men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, while women and other marginalised people tend to only apply when they meet all of them. So, if you think you have what it takes, but don't necessarily tick every box, please apply or get in touch. We'd love to have a chat and see if you could be a great fit.

How to apply
Applications should include a supporting Cover Letter and Resume.
Closing date: Wednesday 29th October 2025
This position is available for Yarra Valley Water employees and external applicants.

We welcome applications from everyone, including Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander peoples, people with disability, mature age and young job seekers, members of the LGBTIQA+ community and people of all cultural backgrounds. If you need this information in an accessible format or would like to discuss reasonable adjustments during the recruitment process, please call 03 9872 2542 or email dei@yvw.com.au. If you need any help with the application process or would like to discuss the recruitment process, please contact us via email recruit@yvw.com.au.

Successful applicants must be eligible to work in Australia and agree to provide information for pre-employment checks, if required for the position. This may also include a Police Check or AusCheck, where an offer will be subject to a satisfactory outcome of these checks.

Company Description


Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.

Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.

Job Description


Visa Consulting & Analytics (VCA) is known for its multi-disciplinary teams, payments expertise and its unique VisaNet data-driven insights.  We support Visa’s ecosystem of partners by advising them on payments strategy, proposition design, digital solutions and portfolio optimisation.  Our clients include banks, retailers, fintechs, airlines and government agencies. 

The VCA Australia, NZ and Pacific Islands team sits within the Asia Pacific advisory practice and has offices in Sydney, Melbourne and Auckland.

The Manager role reflects the increasing demand for VCA in Australia, NZ and the Pacific Islands. Based in Sydney, the Manager will report to Portfolio Optimisation Practice Lead in VCA AuNZPI Consulting team, support projects across consulting service areas as well as driving practice development activities.

This role is ideal for experienced consultants or those who have experience working in product teams within retail banks, who want to apply their strategic problem-solving skills in the fast-evolving payments industry.

What we are looking for:

Our people are intellectually curious, collegial and capable of building trusted relationships with clients.

We look for depth and breadth of experience rather than relying on age or job titles as proxies, and hire for judgment and integrity.  You will be curious about the payments industry, and keen to work alongside a multi-disciplinary team. You will be comfortable managing a consulting engagement project end-to-end, under the guidance of Senior Managers, Directors, or Senior Directors, depending on the size of the engagement.

We are looking for:

Problem solvers: Candidates should be able to quickly understand new issues and apply a structured, intellectually rigorous, and analytically sound approach to solving problems.
Compelling advisers: Candidates should have robust communication skills, including strong oral and written capabilities and the ability to build trust with clients.
Team players: Strong team orientation, collaborative, diplomatic, and flexible, able to work effectively in a matrixed organisation.
Resourceful self-starters: Motivated, results-oriented candidates with the ability to progress multiple projects concurrently.  We are looking for candidates with a bias towards actions rather than passengers.
Dedicated professionals: Strong detail orientation, ensuring the highest level of quality/rigor in our recommendations to clients under time pressure.

What a Client Consulting Manager does at Visa:

You will work on consulting engagements for Visa’s clients (typically banks) in Australia, New Zealand and the Pacific Islands.  Our multi-disciplinary teams provide advice, problem solving skills, data insights and specialist expertise to drive growth and profitability in our clients’ payments businesses. Typical engagements can include:

Strategies to improve customer engagement and retention
Acquisition strategies for targeted customer segments
Enhancing digital customer experience
Profitability optimisation assessment
Credit risk optimisation initiatives and analysis

You will be responsible for significant components of client engagements, and in some cases end-to-end delivery of client engagements. Typically, this will involve the Manager interacting with the client team, gathering and managing project inputs, analysing data to form conclusions and recommendations, developing and presenting compelling project reports and working with clients on executing recommendations. The full range of responsibilities are detailed below.

Responsibilities:

Prepare client proposals and project plans, identifying dependencies, roles and responsibilities, scope and outcomes / deliverables.
Prepare project materials including interview guides, data requirements, concepts and frameworks.
Undertake client interviews, collecting and analysing inputs such as client information, data, processes, policies, competitive and environmental information.
Create compelling PowerPoint presentations to illustrate findings, ideas, recommendations within consulting engagements and more broadly.
Manage junior team members such as Associates, Analysts and Interns.
Ensure project engagements remain on track, utilising governance frameworks and mitigating / resolving complex problems that emerge during engagements.
Identify solutions and recommendations that address client objectives and result in performance improvement.
Support Portfolio Optimisation consulting practice development. Continuously build knowledge, drive new initiatives and support thought leadership pieces.
Collaborate with local client relationship managers/other functional teams to gain insights and support client engagement and execution.

This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your Hiring Manager.

Qualifications


The ideal candidate will likely have:

5+ years of relevant experience in consulting or banking product strategy.
Experience in payments or financial services.
Experience in consumer and business (debit and credit) banking.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, demonstrated through a consistent application of intellectual and analytical rigor.
Strong team orientation, collaborative, flexible, able to work effectively in a matrixed organization and enjoys learning through new challenges.
Superior detail orientation, ensuring the highest level of quality/rigor in reports and data analysis.
Experience in and passion for the power of analytics to yield insights and a proven ability to build models in Microsoft Excel to support business cases.
Strong undergraduate academic accomplishment.
Exposure to customer experience design (using human centered design / design thinking).

Additional Information


Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

Unique opportunity with Aon’s Reinsurance team to support the comprehensive approach to risk assessment, risk transfer and risk mitigation
Effective catastrophe management is an essential component of an insurer’s risk management program.
Open to applicants Australia wide, Aon offers flexible working




Aon is in the business of better decisions




At Aon, we shape decisions for the better to protect and enrich the lives of people around the world.

As an organization, we are united through trust as one inclusive team and we are passionate about helping our colleagues and clients succeed.




What the day will look like




Using significant expertise of all major catastrophe models, our analysts overcome data and model limitations to provide clients with a comprehensive view of their portfolio. The team is in regular dialogue with all major modelling firms and provides clients with detailed explanations for model changes and interpreting their potential effect on results.




Key responsibilities include -  

Utilising catastrophe modelling software to determine clients’ exposure to catastrophe hazards such as earthquake, cyclone and bushfire;
Refining catastrophe models and outputs by analysing clients’ historical data and latest scientific research.
Interrogating client exposure and claim data in MS Excel or SQL to support analyses;
Translating complex technical findings into clear insights and recommendations for internal and external stakeholders
Developing effective working relationships with internal and external clients; and
Actively contributing to climate and natural perils advisory projects.

 

How this opportunity is different




Work at the intersection of the science, risk and business with a direct impact on the management of natural hazards for our clients in Australia and New Zealand.




Together with our actuaries and brokers, our catastrophe team helps clients navigate the challenges of natural peril risk. This includes support for client reinsurance placements and optimising risk transfer strategies, plus on-going research into climate trends and catastrophe model adjustments.




 Skills and experience that will lead to success

The ability to work well within a team, a curious mindset and strong problem-solving and analytical skills
Tertiary qualifications in relevant field of study – natural sciences, engineering, mathematics or statistics
Knowledge of catastrophe modelling software (preferred)
Advanced Excel skills and strong a working knowledge of MS Word, SQL and PowerPoint
Comfortable in client-facing, collaborative, consulting environment with excellent communication skills (both oral and written)
Insurance or reinsurance experience
Experience with VBA, Python, R, Tableau/PowerBI or AI tools an advantage but not essential
Excellent organisation skills and ability to work under pressure
Self-discipline to manage own workflow and deadlines 




How we support our colleagues




In addition to our comprehensive benefits package, we encourage an inclusive workforce. Plus, our agile environment allows you to manage your wellbeing and work/life balance, ensuring you can be your best self at Aon. Furthermore, all colleagues enjoy two “Global Wellbeing Days” each year, encouraging you to take time to focus on yourself.  We offer a variety of working style solutions for our colleagues as well. 




Our continuous learning culture inspires and equips you to learn, share and grow, helping you achieve your fullest potential. As a result, at Aon, you are more connected, more relevant, and more valued.




Aon values an innovative and inclusive workplace where all colleagues feel empowered to be their authentic selves. Aon is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.




Aon provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran, marital, domestic partner status, or other legally protected status. 




We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities and fostering an inclusive workplace. If you require accommodations during the application or interview process, please let us know. You can request accommodations by emailing us at ReasonableAccommodations@Aon.com or your recruiter. We will work with you to meet your needs and ensure a fair and equitable experience.

The Senior Business Analyst is a critical role responsible for leading the analysis, documentation, and management of business requirements across the project lifecycle. Operating within a lending business, undergoing a significant digital and operational transformation, you will ensure that initiatives are aligned with strategic goals, are scoped effectively, and deliver measurable outcomes.

You will work closely with stakeholders to understand business objectives, translating them into operational improvements and robust technical solutions. This role requires strong analytical thinking, exceptional stakeholder engagement, and the ability to communicate clearly across both business and technical audiences.
 
Key focus:
 
The organisation is currently undertaking a significant upgrade to its lending platform. The Senior Business Analyst will play a key role in shaping and delivering these initiatives, including process optimisation and system enhancements.

Strong domain expertise in lending is essential. This includes a solid understanding of the full loan lifecycle:

Loan Origination
Credit Assessment
Servicing
Collections processes
Experience would ideally span a range of financial products, such as mortgages, auto finance, commercial real estate loans, personal loans, and credit cards.

You should be comfortable translating complex financial requirements into system capabilities, working with data models, and supporting workflows for credit decisioning, regulatory compliance, and customer lifecycle management. Familiarity with lending platforms and loan management systems is highly desirable.
 
Key Responsibilities 

Lead the elicitation, documentation, validation, and management of business and functional requirements.
Conduct requirements and scope reviews to ensure alignment with business goals.
Track and manage changes to requirements and scope throughout the project lifecycle.
Validate requirements and ensure traceability from initiation through to delivery.
Perform gap and change analysis to support strategic decision-making and provide recommendations to senior stakeholders.
Process Design and Improvement

Document current state processes and design future state processes using BPMN standards and agreed tooling.
Evaluate existing processes to identify opportunities for improvement and enhance operational efficiency.
Support the adoption of emerging technologies by identifying relevant use cases.
Maintain all documentation in accordance with organisational standards and frameworks.
Solution Assessment and Vendor Engagement

Conduct solution assessments and compare proposed options against defined criteria.
Support the vendor selection processes, including establishing evaluation criteria and reviewing proposals to form recommendations.
Collaborate with business and project teams to assess vendor capabilities and alignment with business needs.
Analyse market trends and perform needs assessments to inform solution design and investment decisions.
** 5 days a week in the office in Sydney **

The Company:

A leading Financial Services business is looking for a Power BI Developer with a strong background in Finance to work on a Financial Reporting uplift project. You must be Sydney based and be able to work in the office 5 days per week.

The Role:

Partner closely with the Data & BI team and key stakeholders to understand requirements and translate into reporting solutions.
Work with complex data sets to build innovative financial reports and dashboards to illustrate key metrics and analytics.
Data analysis of financial information such as credit, funds, cash-flow, ratings, etc.
Drive self-service on Power BI reporting, provide mentoring and coaching on best practices and stay abreast of emerging trends, tools and technologies within data & analytics. 
Your Profile:

Computer Science and/or Finance Degree along with a minimum of 5+ years of experience within a Financial Services environment providing data analysis & analytics.
Proven expertise in using Power BI and DAX for building interactive and real-time Finance related dashboards and reports.
Strong financial & semantic modeling experience.
Hands-on experience in Fabric, SQL, Synapse, Python, Azure DevOps, CI/CD.
AI & ML tools & projects experience.
Superior presentation and storytelling skills.
Please apply below for consideration.

We're looking for a dynamic and experienced Data and Analytics Lead to execute our data function end-to-end — implementing our established data strategy through the delivery of high-impact analytics and data solutions. This role reports directly to the Chief Information Officer (CIO) and plays a critical part in enabling data-driven decision-making across the organisation.

This position requires a minimum of 5-7 years of experience in data and analytics leadership roles.

You'll be responsible for:

Strategy Execution: Implementing our established 3-year data strategy, adapting tactical approaches as business needs evolve.

Hands-on Delivery Leadership: Leading and contributing to the delivery of scalable, high-quality data solutions through a hybrid team of internal and external contributors.

Business Partnership: Acting as a trusted delivery partner to senior stakeholders, translating data into actionable insights that support strategic decisions.

Execution Excellence: Ensuring data initiatives are delivered on time, on budget, and with measurable impact.

This role is ideal for someone who can balance big-picture thinking with hands-on technical delivery — someone who thrives in both stakeholder conversations and delivery stand-ups, and isn't afraid to roll up their sleeves.

Job Description
Technical Skills & Expertise

You bring a strong blend of technical expertise and execution focus, with the ability to lead teams and build solutions that scale. Your toolkit includes:

Business Partnership & Execution

Execute the established data strategy, ensuring alignment with business priorities and delivering measurable outcomes.

Partner with senior leaders across Marketing, Category, Retail, and Finance to understand requirements and translate them into actionable data solutions.

Convert business needs into technical requirements, data models, and analytics outputs that support decision-making.

Identify tactical opportunities to improve business performance through better data integration, automation, and insight generation within existing frameworks.

Balance hands-on technical delivery with stakeholder engagement and team coordination.

Core Platforms & Tools

Snowflake for enterprise-scale data warehousing and integration.

Advanced proficiency in Snowflake is required for this role.

Airflow for orchestration of complex data workflows and job scheduling.

Power BI for advanced reporting, dashboarding, and data storytelling.

SQL and Python for data manipulation, modelling, and automation.

Intermediate level Python programming skills are required.

Microsoft SQL Server, including SSAS, for multidimensional data modeling and OLAP solutions.

DBT for data modelling and transformation.

CI/CD through Bitbucket or similar platforms.

Requirements and work management through sprint management tools like Jira.

Familiarity with data lake architecture, real-time data streaming, and event-driven design.

AI & Emerging Technologies

Interest or exposure to machine learning, automation, and natural language processing (NLP) concepts.

Familiarity with emerging tools such as Snowflake Cortex/Intelligence and Claude for accelerating development and enhancing data workflows.

Comfortable exploring new technologies and assessing their potential to improve data delivery and insight generation.

Delivery & Collaboration

Proven ability to guide internal and external teams in delivering scalable, secure, and high-performing data solutions.

Comfortable working across business and technical domains to ensure alignment and impact.

Team Leadership & Collaboration

You'll lead a hybrid team comprising one internal senior data engineer and an external delivery partner. Your leadership style is hands-on, collaborative, and focused on outcomes.

Lead and align internal and external contributors to deliver high-quality, scalable data solutions.

Take a hands-on approach to delivery, working alongside your senior data engineer to design, build, and deploy solutions rather than purely overseeing work.

Provide technical direction and tactical guidance, ensuring delivery is consistent with business priorities and architectural standards.

Foster a culture of accountability and continuous improvement, encouraging innovation and knowledge sharing across the team.

Act as a mentor and coach, helping uplift internal capability while managing vendor performance and delivery quality.

Collaborate cross-functionally with business units, IT, and external partners to ensure data initiatives are well-integrated and impactful.

Relationship Building & Influence

Support senior stakeholders across Marketing, Category, Retail, and Finance by delivering reliable data solutions and translating findings into actionable insights.

Collaborate cross-functionally to ensure data initiatives are aligned with business needs and integrated into operational workflows.

Build strong working relationships based on delivery excellence, technical credibility, and business understanding.

Manage vendor relationships with a focus on delivery quality, alignment with requirements, and long-term value.

Champion a data culture that values transparency, ethical use, and continuous learning.

Additional Enhancements
What Success Looks Like

Successfully executed key initiatives from the established 3-year data strategy.

Maintained and improved existing data platforms while delivering new capabilities on time and on budget.

Built strong working relationships with business stakeholders, becoming their trusted delivery partner.

Enhanced data quality, reliability, and accessibility across core business functions.

Strengthened internal capability and streamlined external delivery.

Introduced automation and innovation into core data workflows.

Career Growth & Impact

You'll have the opportunity to execute and refine our data roadmap, with input into future strategic direction as the business evolves.

As the business evolves, so can your role — with potential to expand scope and leadership.

Culture & Ways of Working

We value curiosity, ownership, and collaboration.

You'll have the freedom to explore new ideas, challenge the status quo, and make the role your own.

We work hard, support each other, and celebrate wins.




Australian work rights are required for this position.

Do work that matters:

We are seeking a Manager, Technology Strategy to craft Board and ELT strategy papers, research emerging technology trends, frame strategic options, and influence senior decision‑making across the Group. The role reports to the Executive Manager, Technology Strategy, and partners closely with Group Strategy and strategy teams across Retail, Business, Institutional, Technology, Finance, Risk and Operations to ensure CBA's technology strategy is clear, coherent and value‑focused.



If you thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment, have a passion for structured problem solving, and enjoy working across diverse stakeholder groups to deliver impact, this is your opportunity to make a meaningful contribution to the bank's technology transformation.



On any given day you will:


Board & ELT Strategy Papers: Support the development of concise, insight‑rich papers and presentations for the Board, Board committees and ELT-clear problem framing, options and trade‑offs, customer and risk implications, and recommended calls to action.

Executive Influence & Stakeholder Alignment: Build coalitions with senior leaders; run pre‑briefs, socialise positions, reconcile differing views and secure decisions through structured narratives and evidence.

Research & Foresight: Run a continuous market‑intelligence cadence (tech trends, competitor moves, vendor/partner landscape, regulatory shifts). Translate signals into implications for CBA's platforms, data, AI, engineering, cyber, payments and resilience.

Strategic Options Analysis: Develop options analysis and fact packs that quantify value, cost, risk and time; shape buy/partner/build recommendations and prioritisation inputs for planning forums.

Groupwide Technology Strategy Embedment: Promote the technology strategy and its benefits across the organisation so that it is well understood, through targeted strategy forums, communications and Technology showcases.

Enterprise Alignment: Orchestrate alignment with Group Strategy and business‑unit strategies so technology principles, roadmaps and investments directly support CBA's enterprise ambition and customer outcomes.

Scenario Planning & North Star: Facilitate scenario analyses (2-5 year horizons), stress‑testing strategic positions under economic, competitive and regulatory scenarios; update the technology "north star" accordingly.

Strategic Metrics & Outcomes: Define and socialise outcome‑based measures for strategic progress (customer value, reliability/resilience, productivity, risk reduction), linking strategy to benefits realisation.

External Ecosystem Engagement: Curate dialogues with hyperscalers, fintechs, universities and industry bodies; bring back insights and partnership opportunities relevant to CBA's priorities.




Your experience looks like:


Top-Tier Consulting Background: Experience in a leading consulting firm (McKinsey, BCG or Bain) or strategy role within a complex organisation, with a strong foundation in structured problem solving and strategic thinking.

Board‑Quality Communication: Demonstrated ability to convert technical information into crisp narratives and visual storylines for senior audiences, ideally Board/ELT; excellent written, verbal and data‑visualisation skills.

Structured Problem Solving: Expert in issue trees, hypothesis‑driven analysis, options/trade‑off framing and executive synthesis.

Technology Acumen: Working understanding of modern tech domains (cloud, data & AI/ML, platforms, engineering productivity, cyber, resilience, DevOps) and how they create business value.

Market and Competitor Intelligence: Proven capability to scan trends, benchmark peers and synthesise implications for strategy and investment.

Financial & Risk Literacy: Comfort with business cases, value modelling and risk/regulatory considerations in financial services.

Stakeholder Leadership: Track record of influencing C‑level stakeholders and aligning diverse groups to a common decision.

Preferred Background: Financial services experience; degree in Business, Economics, Engineering or Computer Science.




What you will experience in this role:


Cutting-Edge Technology Strategy: A seat at the strategy table shaping multi-year choices on platforms, data/AI, cyber and engineering.

Cross-Bank Collaboration: Work across diverse teams and business units, building strong relationships and fostering alignment on strategic priorities.

Executive Exposure: Gain visibility with senior leadership and contribute to decision making forums and high impact reporting consumed by Board, Executive and investors.

Continuous Learning: Lead and participate in capability uplift initiatives, staying at the forefront of technology strategy and delivery.




Working at CommBank

At CommBank, we support our people with the flexibility to balance where work is done with at least half their time each month connecting in office. We also have many other flexible working options available including changing start and finish times, part-time arrangements and job share to name a few. Talk to us about how these arrangements might work in the role you're interested in.


Whether you're passionate about customer service, driven by data, or called by creativity, a career here is for you.

Our people bring their diverse backgrounds and unique perspectives to build a respectful, inclusive and flexible workplace. We are working hard to build a team of people who represent the rich diversity of our customers and communities. If you're excited about this opportunity but you don't meet every single requirement, or your experience doesn't align perfectly, we still want to encourage you to apply. You may just be the perfect candidate for this opportunity or another within CommBank.

At CommBank we will inspire you with work that makes a difference, surround you with talented people that respect and value each other, and empower you to grow professionally and personally. Most of all, making a positive impact for customers, communities and each other is part of our every day.

We're determined to make a real difference for Australia's first peoples. We encourage all interested applicants to apply. If you're already part of the Commonwealth Bank Group (including Bankwest), you'll need to apply through Sidekick to submit a valid application. We're keen to support you with the next step in your career.

Company description:



Snowy Hydro is a dynamic, integrated energy business that has been providing on-demand, reliable energy to Australia for generations. Snowy Hydro owns and operates a powerful combination of generation assets, including the mighty Snowy Mountains Scheme, gas and diesel plants, and contracted wind and solar energy. We also provide electricity and gas to about 1 million retail customers through our retail brands Red Energy and Lumo Energy.



Job description:

About Snowy:

Snowy Hydro is a dynamic, integrated energy business that has been providing on-demand, reliable energy to Australia for generations. Snowy Hydro owns and operates a powerful combination of generation assets, including the mighty Snowy Mountains Scheme, gas and diesel plants, and contracted wind and solar energy. We also provide electricity and gas to over 1.5 million retail customers through our retail brands Red Energy and Lumo Energy. Snowy 2.0 is Australia's largest committed renewable energy project. This nation-building project will provide on-demand energy and large-scale storage for many generations to come.

About the position:

The Workforce Transformation Data & Insights Analyst is a newly created position that is essential to Snowy's future growth.

The role has been long-anticipated in the organisation, and there is a genuine desire for it. There is a significant amount of work to be done in this space, so the successful candidate will have a real ability to make a difference and enhance capability maturity for Snowy and its workforce.

Key Responsibilities:

Applying advanced analytics and data science techniques to workforce transformation

Benchmarking Snowy Hydro's employee experience and workforce planning against industry standards and best practices

Designing and maintenance of scalable, automated reporting and dashboards

Presenting data to senior stakeholders to improve the employee experience

Shaping a data-informed culture within the Workforce Transformation function by contributing to training and sharing of knowledge

About the location:

This role is based in Sydney.

About you:

You come from a data-driven background

You have strong communication skills, both in person and presenting to groups, with the ability to make data concepts understandable

You'll bring experience using automated tools and dashboards (Tableau, Power BI or similar)

A tertiary qualification in Human Resources, Statistics, Data/Computer Science or a related field

A demonstrated experience of modelling HR data from systems such as SAP Success Factors and familiarity with digital data sources such as survey tools (eg; Qualtrics)

Strong analytical capabilities to identify trends and drive data-informed decisions.

About our workforce:

Snowy Hydro has a culture of decency and inclusion, with a commitment to the health and wellbeing of our people and a supportive environment to ensure that everyone - regardless of background - feels included and can succeed. At Snowy Hydro, we recognise that we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each individual brings, and we believe in providing an environment that allows that uniqueness to thrive.

Snowy Hydro is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for a role with Snowy Hydro and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an email with your request to the Snowy Hydro recruitment team at recruitment@snowyhydro.com.au





Position Description

Senior Investment Data Business Analyst

An excellent opportunity exists for an experienced Senior Investment Data Business Analyst to join a leading superannuation and investment organisation, driving data excellence across its investment operations.

As a key liaison between investment teams, technology experts, and external partners, you will play a pivotal role in translating complex data needs into effective, scalable solutions. This role is ideal for someone who combines strong business analysis expertise with a deep understanding of investment data, and who thrives in a collaborative, fast‑paced environment.

Key Responsibilities

Build and maintain strong relationships with investment stakeholders, understanding and translating business needs into actionable data requirements.

Lead requirements analysis and workshops for investment data and systems initiatives.

Facilitate backlog prioritisation and support the design and delivery of technical solutions.

Develop current and future state process flows, functional specifications, and acceptance criteria.

Collaborate with software developers, data engineers, and vendors on design, configuration, and implementation activities.

Support testing, system rollout, and post‑implementation reviews.

Contribute to governance, knowledge management, and program reporting processes.

Promote continuous improvement across investment data processes and frameworks.

About You

You bring a combination of analytical, technical, and interpersonal skills, enabling you to confidently engage with diverse stakeholder groups and drive data‑driven decision‑making across investment teams.

Essential experience and capabilities:

Significant experience as a Senior Investment Data Business Analyst within investment management or financial services.

Advanced analytical capabilities including requirements decomposition, data modelling, and process mapping.

Strong knowledge of SQL, relational databases, and financial data providers.

Proven experience in system implementation and testing.

Desirable experience:

Exposure to Python, R, Power Query, or similar data wrangling tools.

Experience with data migration or onboarding projects.

Professional certification in data management (e.g. DMBOK).

Familiarity with project methodologies such as Agile, PMBOK, or Prince2.

Proficiency with Jira and Confluence.

What You'll Bring

Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to simplify complex data concepts.

Strategic thinking and forward‑looking problem‑solving skills.

A collaborative mindset and commitment to continuous improvement.

Leadership behaviours aligned with openness, accountability, and integrity.

This role offers a unique opportunity to influence data strategy and system development within a forward‑thinking, purpose‑driven investment environment.

To be considered for the role click the 'apply' button or for more information about this and other opportunities please contact Yash Jain on 03 8680 4238 or email yjain@paxus.com.au and quote the above job reference number.
